item.title: Hajime no Ippo x Bayes: The importance of priors
item.description: Ippo fights Bayesian library(readr) Ippo_record <- read_csv("C:/Users/Alex Kirchner/Desktop/Work/G_PersonalWebsite/data/Ippo_fights_Bayesian.csv", col_types = cols(Date = col_date(format = "%m/%d/%Y"), Number = col_integer(), Record = col_character(), Result = col_factor(levels = c("WIN", "LOSS")), Type = col_factor(levels = c("TKO", "KO")))) Ippo_record <- Ippo_record[!is.na(Ippo_record$Number),] # Grid Approximation p_grid <- seq( from=0 , to=1 , length.out=1000 ) plot(p_grid, type = "line") ## Warning in plot.xy(xy, type, ...): plot type 'line' will be truncated to first ## character prob_p_unif_low <- ifelse(p_grid < 0.

item.title: Post-Doctoral Research Assistant @ University of Kent, Canterbury
item.description: ABOUT ME I am a post-doctoral researcher in Cultural Psychology at the University of Kent. My work explores the many dynamic ways culture is reproduced in our relationships and interactions with others around us, and particularly focuses on the important role of emotions in supporting cultural systems of being and relating (e.g. cultures of honor). My doctoral thesis The Relationality of Feelings: A cultural comparison of affective patterns in Western and East-Asian relationships” has been awarded the Triandis Doctoral Thesis Award 2020 of the International Association of Cross-Cultural Psychology.
